body:
This pass happening after node merging means it could miss an opportunity for a long fusion. For example, for a graph A->B->C->D->E and merge rules {A->B to AB, D->E to DE} and fusion rule {A->B->C->D->E to ABCDE}, the result will be AB->C->DE instead of ABCDE.

If you plan to do a long fusion chain only through merge rules, i.e., {A->B to AB, AB->C to ABC, ...} and only use fusion rules that doesn't contain any patterns already occurred in merge rules, please add a comment clarifying this.
body_html:
This pass happening after node merging means it could miss an opportunity for a long fusion. For example, for a graph A->B->C->D->E and merge rules {A->B to AB, D->E to DE} and fusion rule {A->B->C->D->E to ABCDE}, the result will be AB->C->DE instead of ABCDE.

If you plan to do a long fusion chain only through merge rules, i.e., {A->B to AB, AB->C to ABC, ...} and only use fusion rules that doesn't contain any patterns already occurred in merge rules, please add a comment clarifying this.
body_text:
This pass happening after node merging means it could miss an opportunity for a long fusion. For example, for a graph A->B->C->D->E and merge rules {A->B to AB, D->E to DE} and fusion rule {A->B->C->D->E to ABCDE}, the result will be AB->C->DE instead of ABCDE.
If you plan to do a long fusion chain only through merge rules, i.e., {A->B to AB, AB->C to ABC, ...} and only use fusion rules that doesn't contain any patterns already occurred in merge rules, please add a comment clarifying this.
